meanings.definition: A small cell or group of cells in an embryo that gives rise to specific tissues or organs.
meanings.sent1: The micromeres in the embryo play a crucial role in forming different body parts.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how micromeres develop into specialized tissues in embryos.
meanings.sent3: The micromeres in the tiny embryo had big dreams of becoming important organs one day.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like micromeres transforming into diverse structures.
meanings.sent5: The micromeres were like tiny architects shaping the future of the organism.

meanings.definition: The smallest cells in a developing embryo that differentiate into various cell types.
meanings.sent1: During development, micromeres transform into different cell types in the embryo.
meanings.sent2: The biologist observed the micromeres as they specialized into distinct cell varieties.
meanings.sent3: The micromeres threw a party to celebrate their unique abilities to change into diverse cells.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as versatile as micromeres adapting into various roles.
meanings.sent5: The micromeres were like tiny shape-shifters, morphing into different cell types effortlessly.
